MainCategory.Description: Technical Skills and Experience: This category assesses the candidate's proficiency in required technologies, languages, frameworks, and databases, as well as their overall years of experience in software engineering.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's resume for listed technologies, years of experience, and relevant projects. Conduct technical interviews and coding challenges to assess practical skills. Verify experience through reference checks.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with required technologies. Lacks practical application of skills.
Some experience with required technologies. Can apply skills with guidance.
Strong understanding and practical experience with required technologies. Can independently apply skills and solve problems.
Expert level proficiency in required technologies. Extensive experience and a proven track record of successful projects.

MainCategory.Description: Problem Solving and Analytical Skills: This category evaluates the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess problem-solving skills through technical interview questions, case studies, and algorithmic challenges. Evaluate their ability to break down problems into smaller, manageable parts and develop logical solutions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to analyze complex problems and identify root causes. Has difficulty developing effective solutions.
Can analyze problems with some guidance. Develops basic solutions but may need assistance with complex issues.
Effectively analyzes complex problems, identifies root causes, and develops creative solutions. Can work independently.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. Consistently develops innovative and effective solutions to complex challenges.

MainCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and Best Practices: This category measures the candidate's understanding and application of the SDLC, including design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.  It also assesses their adherence to coding standards, security regulations, and best practices.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's familiarity with different SDLC methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) and their experience in each phase. Inquire about their approach to testing, code reviews, and documentation. Evaluate their understanding of security principles and their ability to write secure code.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of the SDLC and software development best practices.  Struggles to apply these principles in practice.
Basic understanding of the SDLC and some software development best practices.  Requires guidance in applying these principles effectively.
Strong understanding of the SDLC and software development best practices.  Consistently applies these principles in their work.
Expert knowledge of the SDLC and software development best practices.  Champions these principles and mentors others.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration Skills:  This category evaluates the candidate's ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences, as well as their ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess communication skills through interviews, asking the candidate to explain complex technical concepts clearly and concisely. Observe their interaction with the interview panel and assess their ability to listen, provide constructive feedback, and work collaboratively. Check references to gather feedback on their teamwork skills.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills. Difficulty explaining technical concepts and collaborating with others.
Adequate communication skills. Can explain technical concepts with some effort and collaborate effectively with guidance.
Strong communication skills. Clearly and concisely explains technical concepts and effectively collaborates with others.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills. A skilled communicator who can build consensus and effectively lead teams.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality and Documentation: Focuses on the quality, readability, maintainability, and documentation of the code produced by the candidate.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples provided by the candidate, assessing code clarity, commenting, and adherence to coding standards. Evaluate their ability to document requirements and specifications clearly and concisely.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor code quality, lacking comments and documentation. Difficult to understand and maintain.
Acceptable code quality with basic comments and documentation. Requires some improvements for readability and maintainability.
High-quality code with comprehensive comments and documentation. Easy to understand, maintain, and extend.

SubCategory.Description: Database Knowledge (SQL, ORM):  Evaluates the candidate's expertise in relational databases, SQL, and ORM technologies.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess knowledge of database concepts through technical interview questions. Evaluate experience with SQL queries, database design, and ORM frameworks like JPA2 or Hibernate. Use practical exercises involving database interactions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no knowledge of relational databases, SQL, and ORM technologies.
Basic understanding of relational databases, SQL, and ORM technologies. Can perform simple database operations.
Strong knowledge of relational databases, SQL, and ORM technologies. Can design databases, write complex queries, and effectively use ORM frameworks.

SubCategory.Description: Web Application Frameworks: Assesses the candidate's experience with popular web application frameworks (e.g., JSF, Wicket, GWT, Spring MVC).
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's resume and project experience to identify their familiarity with web application frameworks. Ask specific questions about their experience with chosen frameworks, focusing on their ability to develop web applications using these technologies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with web application frameworks.
Some experience with at least one web application framework. Can develop basic web applications with guidance.
Extensive experience with multiple web application frameworks. Can independently develop complex web applications and contribute to framework improvements.

SubCategory.Description: Test-Driven Development (TDD):  Focuses on the candidate's understanding and application of test-driven development principles.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's knowledge of TDD concepts and methodologies. Inquire about their experience writing unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests. Evaluate their ability to write tests before implementing code and to refactor code based on test results.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no understanding of test-driven development.
Basic understanding of TDD principles. Can write simple unit tests with guidance.
Strong understanding and practical experience with test-driven development. Can write comprehensive tests and effectively refactor code based on test results.

SubCategory.Description: Security Awareness: Measures the candidate's awareness of security regulations and their ability to work within the security framework of the company and client.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's understanding of common security vulnerabilities (e.g., SQL injection, cross-site scripting). Inquire about their experience with security best practices, such as input validation, output encoding, and authentication/authorization. Evaluate their ability to follow security guidelines and regulations.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no awareness of security regulations and best practices.
Basic understanding of security principles. Can follow security guidelines with guidance.
Strong understanding of security regulations and best practices. Proactively identifies and addresses security vulnerabilities.
